intro: Alepyrum ciliatum, commonly known as the hairy alepyrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, triangular leaves with hairy margins. Its flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Alepyrum ciliatum is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade.
